solution_line_template: The number of boxes of pizza is {hubert_pizza_boxes} + {ian_pizza_boxes} = <<{hubert_pizza_boxes}+{ian_pizza_boxes}={total_pizza_boxes}>>{total_pizza_boxes} boxes.
The number of cans of soda is {hubert_soda_cans} + {ian_soda_cans} = <<{hubert_soda_cans}+{ian_soda_cans}={total_soda_cans}>>{total_soda_cans} cans.
The {total_pizza_boxes} boxes of pizza cost {total_pizza_boxes} x ${cost_per_pizza_box}= $<<{total_pizza_boxes}*{cost_per_pizza_box}={total_pizza_cost}>>{total_pizza_cost}.
The cost of {total_soda_cans} cans of soda is {total_soda_cans} x ${cost_per_soda_can}= $<<{total_soda_cans}*{cost_per_soda_can}={total_soda_cost}>>{total_soda_cost}.
Therefore, the total amount they spend is ${total_pizza_cost} + ${total_soda_cost} = $<<{total_pizza_cost}+{total_soda_cost}={total_spend}>>{total_spend}
